oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wilma Rudolph
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee State University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wilma Rudolph, Hailed as the "Lady of Gold" and "La Gazelle Noire," Was the First Woman to Win Three Gold Medals In a Single Olympiad. In 1960, She Won the 100-Meter Dash, the 200-Meter Dash, and the 400-Meter Relay in Rome, Italy.
